member.name: T:WindowsFormsAero.AeroForm
member.summary: Base form class that automatically sets its font according to the Windows UX guidelines and supports some Aero properties.

member.name: P:WindowsFormsAero.AeroForm.GlassMargins
member.summary: Gets or sets the glass margins of the form. If set to the glass effect is disabled.
member.remarks: The value contains the borders (in pixels) that are extended into the client area. If all padding values are negative, then the glass area extends to the whole client area. Client area that is marked as glass MUST have a full black background (this is handled automatically by . Controls rendered on TOP of the glass region must use GDI+ for correct alpha handling (default Win32 and Windows Forms controls do not render correctly). Use the provided to render text on top of glass.

member.name: P:WindowsFormsAero.AeroForm.HideTitle
member.summary: Gets or sets whether the window title and icon should be hidden.
member.remarks: The window caption will still be visible, but title text and icon will not. A form with a hidden title will look like an Explorer window on Windows Vista or Windows 7.

member.name: P:WindowsFormsAero.AeroForm.HideCaption
member.summary: Gets or sets whether the window caption should be hidden altogether.
member.remarks: Should be set before handle creation.

member.name: P:WindowsFormsAero.AeroForm.HandleMouseOnGlass
member.summary: Gets or sets whether mouse dragging on glass should be handled automatically.

member.name: T:WindowsFormsAero.Dwm.CloakedStatus
member.summary: Describes whether and why a window is cloaked by the DWM.

member.name: F:WindowsFormsAero.Dwm.CloakedStatus.Uncloaked
member.summary: Window is not cloaked.

member.name: F:WindowsFormsAero.Dwm.CloakedStatus.ApplicationLevel
member.summary: The window was cloaked by its owner application.

member.name: F:WindowsFormsAero.Dwm.CloakedStatus.ShellLevel
member.summary: The window was cloaked by the Shell.

member.name: F:WindowsFormsAero.Dwm.CloakedStatus.Inherited
member.summary: The cloak value was inherited from its owner window.

member.name: T:WindowsFormsAero.Dwm.DwmManager
member.summary: Access to DWM features (e.g., thumbnail registration, glass sheet effect, and blur behind).

member.name: M:WindowsFormsAero.Dwm.DwmManager.Register(System.Windows.Forms.Form,System.IntPtr)
member.summary: Registers a thumbnail to be drawn on a Windows Form.
member.remarks: The thumbnail will not be drawn until you update the thumbnail's properties using .
member.param: The Windows Form instance on which to draw the thumbnail.
The handle (HWND) of the window that has to be drawn.
member.returns: A Thumbnail instance, needed to unregister and to update properties.

member.name: M:WindowsFormsAero.Dwm.DwmManager.Register(System.IntPtr,System.IntPtr)
member.summary: Registers a thumbnail to be drawn on a window.
member.remarks: The thumbnail will not be drawn until you update the thumbnail's properties using .
member.param: The handle (Win32 HWND) of the window on which the thumbnail will be drawn.
The handle (Win32 HWND) of the window that has to be drawn.
member.returns: A Thumbnail instance, needed to unregister and to update properties.

member.name: M:WindowsFormsAero.Dwm.DwmManager.EnableBlurBehind(System.IntPtr)
member.summary: Enable the Aero "Blur Behind" effect on the whole client area. Background of the clint area must be painted in black.

member.name: M:WindowsFormsAero.Dwm.DwmManager.EnableBlurBehind(System.Windows.Forms.Form)
member.summary: Enable the Aero "Blur Behind" effect on the whole client area. Background of the client area must be painted black.

member.name: M:WindowsFormsAero.Dwm.DwmManager.DisableBlurBehind(System.IntPtr)
member.summary: Disables the Aero "Blur Behind" effect.

member.name: M:WindowsFormsAero.Dwm.DwmManager.EnableGlassFrame(System.Windows.Forms.Form,System.Windows.Forms.Padding)
member.summary: Extends the Aero "Glass Frame" into the client area. Background on which the frame is extended must be black.

member.name: M:WindowsFormsAero.Dwm.DwmManager.EnableGlassFrame(System.IntPtr,System.Windows.Forms.Padding)
member.summary: Extends the Aero "Glass Frame" into the client area. Background on which the frame is extended must be black.

member.name: M:WindowsFormsAero.Dwm.DwmManager.EnableGlassSheet(System.Windows.Forms.Form)
member.summary: Extends the Aero "Glass Frame" to the whole client area. Background of the window must be black.

member.name: M:WindowsFormsAero.Dwm.DwmManager.EnableGlassSheet(System.IntPtr)
member.summary: Extends the Aero "Glass Frame" to the whole client area. Background of the window must be black.

member.name: M:WindowsFormsAero.Dwm.DwmManager.DisableGlassFrame(System.Windows.Forms.Form)
member.summary: Disables the Aero "Glass Frame".

member.name: M:WindowsFormsAero.Dwm.DwmManager.DisableGlassFrame(System.IntPtr)
member.summary: Disables the Aero "Glass Frame".

member.name: M:WindowsFormsAero.Dwm.DwmManager.SetWindowFlip3dPolicy(System.Windows.Forms.Form,WindowsFormsAero.Flip3DPolicy)
member.summary: Sets a window's Flip 3D policy.
member.param: Form whose Flip 3D state should be altered.
Desired Flip 3D policy.
member.remarks: Is ignored on OSs that do not support Aero.

Desired Flip 3D policy.
member.remarks: Is ignored on OSs that do not support Aero.

member.name: M:WindowsFormsAero.Dwm.DwmManager.SetDisallowPeek(System.Windows.Forms.Form,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Sets whether Aero Peek is enabled or disabled on a window.
member.param: Form whose Aero Peek state should be altered.
True if Aero Peek should be disabled for the window. False otherwise.
member.remarks: Is ignored on OSs that do not support Aero Peek.

member.name: M:WindowsFormsAero.Dwm.DwmManager.SetDisallowPeek(System.IntPtr,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Sets whether Aero Peek is enabled or disabled on a window.
member.param: Handle of the window whose Aero Peek state should be altered.
True if Aero Peek should be disabled for the window. False otherwise.
member.remarks: Is ignored on OSs that do not support Aero Peek.

member.name: M:WindowsFormsAero.Dwm.DwmManager.SetExcludeFromPeek(System.Windows.Forms.Form,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Sets whether Aero Peek excludes or includes a window.
member.param: Form whose Aero Peek exclusion state is to be set.
Set to true to exlude the window from Aero Peek.
member.remarks: Is ignored on OSs that do not support Aero Peek.

member.name: M:WindowsFormsAero.Dwm.DwmManager.IsCloaked(System.Windows.Forms.Form)
member.summary: Gets whether a form is cloaked.
member.remarks: Always returns on unsupported OSs.

member.summary: Gets whether a window is cloaked.
member.remarks: Always returns on unsupported OSs.

member.summary: Sets a form's cloak status.
member.remarks: Is ignored on OSs that do not support cloaking.

member.name: M:WindowsFormsAero.Dwm.DwmManager.SetCloak(System.IntPtr,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Sets a window's cloak status.
member.remarks: Is ignored on OSs that do not support cloaking.

member.name: M:WindowsFormsAero.Dwm.DwmManager.IsFrozen(System.IntPtr)
member.summary: Gets whether a window's DWM representation is frozen.
member.param: Handle of the window whose representation status must be returned.
member.returns: Returns false on OSs that do not support frozen DWM representation.

member.summary: Gets whether a window's DWM representation is frozen.
member.param: Form whose representation status must be returned.
member.returns: Returns false on OSs that do not support frozen DWM representation.

member.summary: Sets whether a window's DWM representation is frozen.

True if the window's DWM representation should be frozen.
member.remarks: Is ignored on OSs that do not support frozen DWM representation.

member.summary: Sets whether a window's DWM representation is frozen.
member.param: Form whose representation status should be set.
True if the window's DWM representation should be frozen.
member.remarks: Is ignored on OSs that do not support frozen DWM representation.

member.name: T:WindowsFormsAero.Dwm.Thumbnail
member.summary: Handle to a DWM Thumbnail.
member.remarks: Handles to can be created only through by registering a new thumbnail of an existing Form or Win32 window. Thumbnails can be manipulated and should be disposed through this class. Thumbnails can be automatically handled by the Windows Forms control. The or methods must be called at least once in order for the Thumbnail to be visible.

member.name: P:WindowsFormsAero.Dwm.Thumbnail.Opacity
member.summary: Gets or sets the thumbnail opacity value, from 0 (transparent) to 255 (fully opaque).
member.remarks: This property appears to be ignored in Windows 10 Anniversary Update.

member.name: P:WindowsFormsAero.Dwm.Thumbnail.ShowOnlyClientArea
member.summary: Gets or sets whether only the client area of the thumbnailed window should be shown or its entire window area.

member.name: P:WindowsFormsAero.Dwm.Thumbnail.DestinationRectangle
member.summary: Gets or sets the area in the destination window on which the thumbnail should be drawn.

member.name: P:WindowsFormsAero.Dwm.Thumbnail.SourceRectangle
member.summary: Sets the region of the source window that should be drawn.
member.remarks: This read-only property cannot be unset once set. In order to reset the Thumbnail's source rectangle, a new instance must be created.

member.name: P:WindowsFormsAero.Dwm.Thumbnail.Visible
member.summary: Gets or sets whether the thumbnail should be shown or not.

member.name: M:WindowsFormsAero.Dwm.Thumbnail.GetSourceSize
member.summary: Retrieves the thumbnailed window's size.

member.name: M:WindowsFormsAero.Dwm.Thumbnail.Update(System.Drawing.Rectangle,System.Drawing.Rectangle,System.Byte,System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Updates the thumbnail's display settings.
member.param: Drawing region on destination window.
Origin region from source window.
Opacity. 0 is transparent, 255 opaque.
Visibility flag.
If true, only the client area of the window will be rendered. Otherwise, the borders will be be rendered as well.

member.name: M:WindowsFormsAero.Dwm.Thumbnail.Update(System.Drawing.Rectangle,System.Byte,System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Updates the thumbnail's display settings.
member.param: Drawing region on destination window.
Opacity. 0 is transparent, 255 opaque.
Visibility flag.
If true, only the client area of the window will be rendered. Otherwise, the borders will be be rendered as well.

member.name: M:WindowsFormsAero.Dwm.ThumbnailViewer.SetThumbnail(System.Windows.Forms.Form,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Sets the origin of the thumbnail and shows the thumbnail on the control.
member.param: The Form instance that will be thumbnailed.
True if the control should automatically update itself in case the thumbnailed form changes size or is closed.

member.name: M:WindowsFormsAero.Dwm.ThumbnailViewer.UpdateThumbnail
member.summary: Forces an update of the thumbnail.
member.remarks: Use this method if you know that the thumbnailed window has been resized and the thumbnail control should react to these changes.

member.name: T:WindowsFormsAero.Flip3DPolicy
member.summary: Determines a window's Flip 3D policy.

member.name: F:WindowsFormsAero.Flip3DPolicy.Default
member.summary: Default Flip 3D behavior.

member.name: F:WindowsFormsAero.Flip3DPolicy.ExcludeBelow
member.summary: Excludes the window from Flip 3D and hides it behind the animation.

member.name: F:WindowsFormsAero.Flip3DPolicy.ExcludeAbove
member.summary: Excludes the window from Flip 3D and shows it above the animation.

member.name: M:WindowsFormsAero.GeometryExtensions.IsPositive(System.Windows.Forms.Padding)
member.summary: Returns true if any side of the padding is a positive, non-zero value.

member.name: M:WindowsFormsAero.GeometryExtensions.AllNegative(System.Windows.Forms.Padding)
member.summary: Returns true if all sides are negative.

member.name: M:WindowsFormsAero.GeometryExtensions.IsOutside(System.Windows.Forms.Padding,System.Drawing.Point,System.Drawing.Size)
member.summary: Returns whether a point in client coordinates is outside the padded region.
member.param: Point in client coordinates.
Full size of the region on which padding is applied.

member.name: T:WindowsFormsAero.HorizontalPanel
member.summary: A horizontal panel which resembles what is used for information and navigation in the Control Panel of Windows 7 and Vista.
member.remarks: This control is meant to be used on the left hand side of a form, it creates a graphic border on the right hand side. Also I have VB code for this control if anyone needs it, just send me an e-mail at bpell@indiana.edu or blakepell@hotmail.com.

member.name: M:WindowsFormsAero.HorizontalPanel.#ctor
member.summary: Constructor
member.remarks:
We are by default setting the background color to Color.Transparent. The reason for this is that a lot of controls that will be used with this, namingly the Label and LinkLabel default their back color to the color of the panel and for those controls to display properly on this panel, their BackColor will need to be Color.Transparent (otherwise, they'll display as a black box). This should help to isolate the developer from having to research this.
To reduce flicker, especially when glass is enabled, I had to set all three of the below styles.

member.name: M:WindowsFormsAero.HorizontalPanel.OnControlAdded(System.Windows.Forms.ControlEventArgs)
member.summary: When a control is added, we will check the type and if it meets certain criteria will change some default behaviors of the control so that it fits our theme by default. The developer can still change this as they desire after it's added.

member.name: M:WindowsFormsAero.HorizontalPanel.OnPaint(System.Windows.Forms.PaintEventArgs)
member.summary: The actual painting of the background of our control.
member.remarks: The colors in use here were extracted from an image of the Control Panel taken from a Windows 7 RC1 installation.

member.name: M:WindowsFormsAero.HorizontalPanel.RedrawControlAsBitmap(System.IntPtr)
member.summary: This procedure will redraw any control, given it's handl as an image on the form. This is necessary if you want to lay this control on top of the glass surface of an Aero form.

member.name: M:WindowsFormsAero.HorizontalPanel.WndProc(System.Windows.Forms.Message@)
member.summary: Handles incoming Windows Messages.
member.remarks: On the paint event and if the RenderOnGlass is set to true, we will redraw the control as an image directly on the form. This has a little extra overhead but also provides the ability to lay this control directly on the glass and have it rendered correctly.

member.name: P:WindowsFormsAero.HorizontalPanel.RenderOnGlass
member.summary: Whether or not the control needs to be rendered on the Glass surface.
member.remarks: This is false by default, it should only be toggled to true if the control needs to lay directly on the glass surface of the form.

member.name: T:WindowsFormsAero.LabeledDivider
member.summary: The labeled divider provides a Aero styled divider with an optional caption, similiar to what is seen in the Control Panel dialogs of Windows 7 and Vista.

member.name: M:WindowsFormsAero.LabeledDivider.#ctor
member.summary: Constructor

member.name: M:WindowsFormsAero.LabeledDivider.OnPaint(System.Windows.Forms.PaintEventArgs)
member.summary: The actual painting of the background of our control.
member.remarks: The colors in use here were extracted from an image of the Control Panel taken from a Windows 7 RC1 installation.

member.name: T:WindowsFormsAero.LabeledDivider.DividerPositions
member.summary: The positions that the divider line can be drawn in

member.name: F:WindowsFormsAero.LabeledDivider.DividerPositions.Center
member.summary: The divider will be centered after the text caption and will begin drawing after the string. This is the default behavior.

member.name: F:WindowsFormsAero.LabeledDivider.DividerPositions.Below
member.summary: The divider will be drawn below the text caption.

member.name: P:WindowsFormsAero.LabeledDivider.DividerPosition
member.summary: The position of the divider line.
member.remarks: The default value is the center position which is consistent on how this type of divider has been used throughout the Windows 7 and Vista UI's.

member.name: P:WindowsFormsAero.LabeledDivider.DividerColor
member.summary: The color of the divider line.

member.name: P:WindowsFormsAero.LabeledDivider.Text
member.summary: The text that should be used for the caption. If the caption is set to blank and the divider position is set to center then a simple divider line will be drawn.
member.remarks: After a change is made to the text property we want to invalidate the control so it triggers a new paint message being sent.

member.name: T:WindowsFormsAero.SplitButton
member.summary: A complex button provided with a secondary split push button that open up a context menu.
member.remarks: See: http://www.codeproject.com/KB/vista/themedvistacontrols.aspx

member.name: E:WindowsFormsAero.SplitButton.SplitClick
member.summary: Occurs when the split label is clicked.

member.name: E:WindowsFormsAero.SplitButton.SplitMenuOpening
member.summary: Occurs when the split label is clicked, but before the associated context menu is displayed by the control.

member.name: P:WindowsFormsAero.SplitButton.SplitMenuStrip
member.summary: Gets or sets the associated context menu that is displayed when the split glyph of the button is clicked.

member.name: P:WindowsFormsAero.SplitButton.SplitMenu
member.summary: Gets or sets the associated context menu that is displayed when the split glyph of the button is clicked.
member.remarks: Exposed for backward compatibility with legacy context menu classes. If both and are set, the first is preferred.

member.name: P:WindowsFormsAero.SplitButton.SplitButtonAlignLeft
member.summary: Gets or sets whether the split button should be aligned on the left side of the button.

member.name: P:WindowsFormsAero.SplitButton.SplitButtonNoSplit
member.summary: Gets or sets whether the split button should be shown or not.

member.name: T:WindowsFormsAero.SplitMenuEventArgs
member.summary: Provides data for the clicking of split buttons and the opening of context menus.
member.remarks: See: http://www.codeproject.com/KB/vista/themedvistacontrols.aspx

member.name: P:WindowsFormsAero.SplitMenuEventArgs.DrawArea
member.summary: Represents the bounding box of the clicked button.
member.remarks: A menu should be opened, with top-left coordinates in the left-bottom point of the rectangle and with width equal (or greater) than the width of the rectangle.

member.name: P:WindowsFormsAero.SplitMenuEventArgs.PreventOpening
member.summary: Set to true if you want to prevent the menu from opening.

member.summary: Gets the ID of the checked radio control.

member.name: T:WindowsFormsAero.TaskDialog.TaskDialog
member.summary: Displays a complex dialog box that can contain text, icons, buttons, command links, radio buttons, and/or a progress bar.

member.name: M:WindowsFormsAero.TaskDialog.TaskDialog.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new Task Dialog instance without text.

member.name: M:WindowsFormsAero.TaskDialog.TaskDialog.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Initializes a new Task Dialog instance with text.
member.param: The main instruction to display.

member.name: M:WindowsFormsAero.TaskDialog.TaskDialog.#ctor(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Initializes a new Task Dialog instance with an instruction and a title.
member.param: The main instruction to display.
The title of the Task Dialog.

member.name: M:WindowsFormsAero.TaskDialog.TaskDialog.#ctor(System.String,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Initializes a new Task Dialog instance with an instruction, a title and some content text.
member.param: The main instruction to display.
The title of the Task Dialog.
The content text that will be shown below the main instruction.

member.name: M:WindowsFormsAero.TaskDialog.TaskDialog.#ctor(System.String,System.String,System.String,WindowsFormsAero.TaskDialog.CommonButton)
member.summary: Initializes a new Task Dialog instance with an instruction, a title, some content text and a specific button.
member.param: The main instruction to display.
The title of the Task Dialog.
The content text that will be shown below the main instruction.
Specifies one or more buttons to be displayed on the bottom of the dialog, instead of the default OK button.

The title of the Task Dialog.
The content text that will be shown below the main instruction.
Specifies one or more buttons to be displayed on the bottom of the dialog, instead of the default OK button.
The icon to display.

member.name: P:WindowsFormsAero.TaskDialog.TaskDialog.IsShowing
member.summary: Is true if the task dialog is currently displayed.

member.name: P:WindowsFormsAero.TaskDialog.TaskDialog.Title
member.summary: Gets or sets the title of the dialog.

member.name: P:WindowsFormsAero.TaskDialog.TaskDialog.CommonIcon
member.summary: Gets or sets the icon of the dialog, from a set of common icons.

member.name: P:WindowsFormsAero.TaskDialog.TaskDialog.CustomIcon
member.summary: Gets or sets the icon of the dialog, from a custom Icon instance.

member.name: P:WindowsFormsAero.TaskDialog.TaskDialog.CommonButtons
member.summary: Gets or sets the dialog's buttons, from one or more common button types.

member.name: P:WindowsFormsAero.TaskDialog.TaskDialog.CustomButtons
member.summary: Gets or sets a set of custom buttons which will be displayed on the dialog.
member.remarks: These buttons can also be shown as Command Links optionally.

member.name: P:WindowsFormsAero.TaskDialog.TaskDialog.DefaultButton
member.summary: Gets or sets the integer ID of the dialog's default button.
member.remarks: You may use any custom ID or one of the common button IDs in .

member.name: P:WindowsFormsAero.TaskDialog.TaskDialog.RadioButtons
member.summary: Gets or sets a set of custom buttons which will be displayed as radio buttons.

member.name: P:WindowsFormsAero.TaskDialog.TaskDialog.EnabledRadioButton
member.summary: Gets or sets the identificator of the enabled radio button by default.

member.name: P:WindowsFormsAero.TaskDialog.TaskDialog.VerificationText
member.summary: Gets or sets the text that will be shown next to a verification checkbox.

member.name: P:WindowsFormsAero.TaskDialog.TaskDialog.ExpandedControlText
member.summary: Gets or sets the text displayed on the control that enables the user to expand and collapse the dialog, when the dialog is in expanded mode.

member.name: P:WindowsFormsAero.TaskDialog.TaskDialog.CollapsedControlText
member.summary: Gets or sets the text displayed on the control that enables the user to expand and collapse the dialog, when the dialog is in collapsed mode.

member.name: P:WindowsFormsAero.TaskDialog.TaskDialog.FooterCommonIcon
member.summary: Gets or sets the icon shown in the dialog's footer, from a set of common icons.

member.name: P:WindowsFormsAero.TaskDialog.TaskDialog.FooterCustomIcon
member.summary: Gets or sets the icon shown in the dialog's footer, from a custom Icon instance.

member.name: P:WindowsFormsAero.TaskDialog.TaskDialog.Width
member.summary: Explicitly sets the desired width in pixels of the dialog.
member.remarks: Will be set automatically by the task dialog to an optimal size.

member.name: P:WindowsFormsAero.TaskDialog.TaskDialog.Instruction
member.summary: Gets or Sets the Main Instruction text of the TaskDialog. Can be updated when the dialog is shown.
member.remarks: Text written in blue and slightly bigger font in Windows Aero.

member.name: P:WindowsFormsAero.TaskDialog.TaskDialog.Content
member.summary: Gets or sets the Content text of the TaskDialog. Can be updated when the dialog is shown.
member.remarks: Text written with standard font, right below the Main instruction.

member.name: P:WindowsFormsAero.TaskDialog.TaskDialog.ExpandedInformation
member.summary: Gets or Sets the expanded information text, that will be optionally shown by clicking on the Expand control.

member.name: P:WindowsFormsAero.TaskDialog.TaskDialog.Footer
member.summary: Gets or Sets the Footer text.

member.name: P:WindowsFormsAero.TaskDialog.TaskDialog.ProgressBarPosition
member.summary: Gets or sets the current progress bar value.

member.name: P:WindowsFormsAero.TaskDialog.TaskDialog.ProgressBarMinRange
member.summary: Gets of sets the minimum value allowed by the Progress bar.

member.name: P:WindowsFormsAero.TaskDialog.TaskDialog.ProgressBarMaxRange
member.summary: Gets or sets the maximum value allowed by the Progress bar.

member.name: P:WindowsFormsAero.TaskDialog.TaskDialog.ProgressBarState
member.summary: Gets or sets the current Progress bar state.
member.remarks: Determines the bar's color and behavior.

member.name: P:WindowsFormsAero.TaskDialog.TaskDialog.EnableHyperlinks
member.summary: Enables or disables Hyperlinks in the dialog's content.
member.remarks: Hyperlinks can be expressed using HTML, in the form of and tags. The link is reported back through the event.

member.name: P:WindowsFormsAero.TaskDialog.TaskDialog.AllowDialogCancellation
member.summary: Gets or sets whether the dialog can be cancelled (ESC, ALT+F4 and X button) even if no common Cancel button has been specified.

member.name: P:WindowsFormsAero.TaskDialog.TaskDialog.UseCommandLinks
member.summary: Gets or sets whether Command Link buttons should be used instead of standard custom buttons (doesn't apply to common buttons, like OK or Cancel).

member.name: P:WindowsFormsAero.TaskDialog.TaskDialog.UseCommandLinksWithoutIcon
member.summary: Gets or sets whether Command Link buttons without icon should be used instead of standard custom buttons (doesn't apply to common buttons, like OK or Cancel).

member.name: P:WindowsFormsAero.TaskDialog.TaskDialog.ShowExpandedInfoInFooter
member.summary: Gets or sets whether the ExpandedInformation should be shown in the Footer area (instead of under the Content text).

member.name: P:WindowsFormsAero.TaskDialog.TaskDialog.IsExpanded
member.summary: Gets or sets whether the ExpandedInformation is visible on dialog creation.

member.name: P:WindowsFormsAero.TaskDialog.TaskDialog.IsVerificationChecked
member.summary: Gets or sets whether the Verification checkbox should be checked when the dialog is shown.

member.name: P:WindowsFormsAero.TaskDialog.TaskDialog.ShowProgressBar
member.summary: Gets or sets whether a progress bar should be displayed on the dialog.

member.name: P:WindowsFormsAero.TaskDialog.TaskDialog.EnableCallbackTimer
member.summary: Sets or gets whether the user specified callback (if any) should be called every 200ms.

member.name: P:WindowsFormsAero.TaskDialog.TaskDialog.PositionRelativeToWindow
member.summary: Gets or sets whether the dialog should be positioned centered on the parent window.

member.name: P:WindowsFormsAero.TaskDialog.TaskDialog.RightToLeftLayout
member.summary: Enables or disables right to left reading order.

member.name: P:WindowsFormsAero.TaskDialog.TaskDialog.NoDefaultRadioButton
member.summary: Gets or sets whether there should be no selected radio button by default when the dialog is shown.

member.name: P:WindowsFormsAero.TaskDialog.TaskDialog.CanBeMinimized
member.summary: Gets or sets whether the dialog may be minimized or not.

member.param: Numeric id of the clicked button.

member.name: M:WindowsFormsAero.TaskDialog.TaskDialog.SimulateRadioButtonClick(System.Int32)
member.summary: Injects a virtual radio button click.
member.param: Numeric id of the clicked radio button.

member.name: M:WindowsFormsAero.TaskDialog.TaskDialog.SimulateVerificationClick(System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Injects a virtual checkbox click.
member.param: New state of the verification checkbox.
Sets whether the checkbox should have focus after state change.

member.name: M:WindowsFormsAero.TaskDialog.TaskDialog.EnableButton(System.Int32,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Enables or disables a button of the dialog.
member.param: Id of the button whose state will be changed.
New state of the button.

member.name: M:WindowsFormsAero.TaskDialog.TaskDialog.EnableRadioButton(System.Int32,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Enables or disables a radio button of the dialog.
member.param: Id of the radio button whose state will be changed.
New state of the button.

member.name: M:WindowsFormsAero.TaskDialog.TaskDialog.Navigate(WindowsFormsAero.TaskDialog.TaskDialog)
member.summary: Creates a new Task Dialog setup and replaces the existing one. Note that the window will not be destroyed and that you should keep the existing TaskDialog reference (event handlers will still be registered). The existing Task Dialog will simply reset and use the options of the new one.
member.param: An instance of Task Dialog, whose settings will be copied into the existing dialog. You may safely destroy the nextDialog instance after use (do not register to events on it).

member.name: M:WindowsFormsAero.TaskDialog.TaskDialog.SetShieldButton(System.Int32,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Adds or removes an UAC Shield icon from a button.
member.param: Id of the button.
Sets whether to display a Shield icon or not.

member.name: M:WindowsFormsAero.TaskDialog.TaskDialog.SetMarqueeProgressBar(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Sets whether the dialog's progress bar should be in standard or in marquee mode.
member.param: True if the progress bar should be displayed in marquee mode (no explicit progress).

member.name: M:WindowsFormsAero.TaskDialog.TaskDialog.SetMarqueeProgressBar(System.Boolean,System.Int32)
member.summary: Sets whether the dialog's progress bar should be in standard or in marquee mode and sets its marquee speed.
member.param: True if the progress bar should be displayed in marquee mode (no explicit progress).
Speed of the progress bar in marquee mode.

member.name: E:WindowsFormsAero.TaskDialog.TaskDialog.Created
member.summary: Occurs when the Task Dialog is first created and before it is displayed (is sent after Construction event).

member.name: E:WindowsFormsAero.TaskDialog.TaskDialog.ButtonClick

member.name: E:WindowsFormsAero.TaskDialog.TaskDialog.RadioButtonClick
member.summary: Occurs when the user selects a radio button.

member.summary: Occurs when the Task Dialog is constructed and before it is displayed (is sent before Creation event).

member.summary: Occurs when the user switches the state of the Verification Checkbox.

member.summary: Occurs when the user presses F1 when the Task Dialog has focus.

member.name: E:WindowsFormsAero.TaskDialog.TaskDialog.Expanding
member.summary: Occurs when the user clicks on the expand button of the dialog, before the dialog is expanded.

member.summary: Common native callback for Task Dialogs. Will route events to the user event handler.

member.summary: Prepares the internal configuration structure.
member.remarks: Allocates some unmanaged memory, must always be followed by a PostConfig() call.

member.name: P:WindowsFormsAero.TextBox.CueBannerText
member.summary: Gets or sets the cue text that is displayed on the TextBox control.

member.name: P:WindowsFormsAero.TextBox.ShowCueFocused
member.summary: Gets or sets whether the Cue text should be displyed even when the control has keybord focus.
member.remarks: If true, the Cue text will disappear as soon as the user starts typing.

member.name: T:WindowsFormsAero.ThemeLabel
member.summary: A Label displaying text with themeing options (glow, drop shadows, etc.) that can be shown on transparent surfaces (esp. extended frames for the so-called "Glass Sheet" effect).

member.name: P:WindowsFormsAero.ThemeLabel.GlowSize
member.summary: Size of the glow effect around the text.

member.name: P:WindowsFormsAero.ThemeLabel.GlowEnabled
member.summary: Enables or disables the glow effect around the text.

member.name: P:WindowsFormsAero.ThemeLabel.TextAlign
member.summary: Gets or sets the horizontal text alignment setting.

member.name: P:WindowsFormsAero.ThemeLabel.TextAlignVertical
member.summary: Gets or sets the vertical text alignment setting.

member.name: P:WindowsFormsAero.ThemeLabel.SingleLine
member.summary: Gets or sets whether the text will be laid out on a single line or on multiple lines.

member.name: P:WindowsFormsAero.ThemeLabel.EndEllipsis
member.summary: Gets or sets whether the text lines over the label's border should be trimmed with an ellipsis.

member.name: P:WindowsFormsAero.ThemeLabel.WordBreak
member.summary: Gets or sets whether the text should break only at the end of a word.

member.name: P:WindowsFormsAero.ThemeLabel.WordEllipsis
member.summary: Gets or sets whether the text should be trimmed to the last word and an ellipse should be placed at the end of the line.

member.name: T:WindowsFormsAero.ThemedText
member.summary: Renders themed text.
member.remarks: Needs major reworking to be exposed as a public class.

member.name: F:WindowsFormsAero.ThemedText.DefaultGlowSize
member.summary: Default glow size.

member.name: F:WindowsFormsAero.ThemedText.Word2007GlowSize
member.summary: Glow size used commonly by Office 2007 in titles.

member.name: M:WindowsFormsAero.ThemedText.PrepareHdc(System.IntPtr,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Ensures that a valid source HDC exists and has been rendered to.

member.name: T:WindowsFormsAero.VerticalPanel
member.summary: A vertical panel which resembles what is used for information and navigation in the Control Panel of Windows 7 and Vista.
member.remarks: This control is meant to be used on the left hand side of a form, it creates a graphic border on the right hand side. Also I have VB code for this control if anyone needs it, just send me an e-mail at bpell@indiana.edu or blakepell@hotmail.com.

member.name: M:WindowsFormsAero.VerticalPanel.#ctor
member.summary: Constructor.
member.remarks: We are by default setting the background color to Color.Transparent. The reason for this is that a lot of controls that willbe used with this, namingly the Label and LinkLabel default their back color to the color of the panel and for those controls to display properly on this panel, thei BackColor will need to be Color.Transparent (otherwise, they'll display as a black box). This should help to isolate the developer from having to research this. To reduce flicker, especially when glass is enabled, I had to set all three of the below styles.

member.name: M:WindowsFormsAero.VerticalPanel.OnControlAdded(System.Windows.Forms.ControlEventArgs)
member.summary: When a control is added, we will check the type and if it meets certain criteria will change some default behaviors of the control so that it fits our theme by default. The developer can still change this as they desire after it's added.

member.name: M:WindowsFormsAero.VerticalPanel.OnPaint(System.Windows.Forms.PaintEventArgs)
member.summary: The actual painting of the background of our control.
member.remarks: The colors in use here were extracted from an image of the Control Panel taken from a Windows 7 RC1 installation.

member.name: M:WindowsFormsAero.VerticalPanel.RedrawControlAsBitmap(System.IntPtr)
member.summary: This procedure will redraw any control, given its handle, as an image on the form. This is necessary if you want to lay this control on top of the glass surface of an Aero form.

member.name: M:WindowsFormsAero.VerticalPanel.WndProc(System.Windows.Forms.Message@)
member.summary: Handles incoming Windows Messages.
member.remarks: On the paint event and if the RenderOnGlass is set to true, we will redraw the control as an image directly on the form. This has a little extra overhead but also provides the ability to lay this control directly on the glass and have it rendered correctly.

member.name: P:WindowsFormsAero.VerticalPanel.RenderOnGlass
member.summary: Whether or not the control needs to be rendered on the Glass surface.
member.remarks: This is false by default, it should only be toggled to true if the control needs to lay directly on the glass surface of the form.

member.name: T:WindowsFormsAero.VirtualDesktop
member.summary: Represents a virtual desktop instance.

member.name: P:WindowsFormsAero.VirtualDesktop.Id
member.summary: Gets the virtual desktop's ID.

member.name: T:WindowsFormsAero.VirtualDesktopManager
member.summary: Exposes methods that enable an application to interact with groups of windows that form virtual workspaces.

member.name: M:WindowsFormsAero.VirtualDesktopManager.IsWindowOnCurrentVirtualDesktop(System.IntPtr)
member.summary: Indicates whether the provided window is on the currently active virtual desktop.
member.param: Top-level window handle.
member.returns: True if the provided window is on the currently active virtual desktop or if there is only one desktop.
member.remarks: Always returns true on OSs that do not support virtual desktops.

member.name: M:WindowsFormsAero.VirtualDesktopManager.IsWindowOnCurrentVirtualDesktop(System.Windows.Forms.Form)
member.summary: Indicates whether the provided form is on the currently active virtual desktop.
member.param: Top-level form.
member.returns: True if the provided window is on the currently active virtual desktop or if there is only one desktop.
member.remarks: Always returns true on OSs that do not support virtual desktops.

member.name: M:WindowsFormsAero.VirtualDesktopManager.GetWindowDesktopId(System.IntPtr)
member.summary: Gets the handle for the virtual desktop hosting the provided top-level window.
member.param: Top-level window handle.
member.returns: Virtual desktop handle hosting the provided top-level window.
member.remarks: Returns default virtual desktop handle on OSs that do not support virtual desktops.

member.name: M:WindowsFormsAero.VirtualDesktopManager.GetWindowDesktopId(System.Windows.Forms.Form)
member.summary: Gets the handle for the virtual desktop hosting the provided top-level form.
member.param: Top-level form.
member.returns: Virtual desktop handle hosting the provided top-level window.
member.remarks: Returns default virtual desktop handle on OSs that do not support virtual desktops.

member.name: M:WindowsFormsAero.VirtualDesktopManager.MoveWindowToDesktop(System.IntPtr,WindowsFormsAero.VirtualDesktop)
member.summary: Moves a window to the specified virtual desktop.
member.param: Top-level window handle.
Target virtual desktop handle.
member.remarks: Is ignored on OSs that do not support virtual desktops.

member.name: M:WindowsFormsAero.VirtualDesktopManager.MoveWindowToDesktop(System.Windows.Forms.Form,WindowsFormsAero.VirtualDesktop)
member.summary: Moves a form to the specified virtual desktop.
member.param: Top-level form.
Target virtual desktop handle.
member.remarks: Is ignored on OSs that do not support virtual desktops.
